content:
Project Documentation: Sample File#This file serves as a random example of various Markdown formatting options.
Markdown is intended to be as easy-to-read and easy-to-write as possible.
1. Text Formatting#You can easily format text to add emphasis:
This text is italic or italic. This text is bold or bold. This text is bold and italic. This text includes a strikethrough. 2. Lists#Unordered List#Use hyphens, asterisks, or plus signs.
First item in an unordered list. Another item. Nested item (indent with two spaces). Another nested item. Back to the main list. Ordered List#Use numbers followed by periods. The actual numbers used don’t matter, as the rendering engine will order them correctly.
First step. Next step. Third step. 3. Links and Images#Link: Visit the Markdown Guide Image: Optional Title4. Blockquotes#Use the > symbol for blockquotes.
This is a blockquote. It’s often used to highlight quotes or important information.
This is a nested blockquote.
5. Code#Inline Code#Wrap code within single backticks (`):
Use the printf() function in C.
Code Block#Wrap a block of code with triple backticks (```) for syntax highlighting (e.g., md for Markdown or python for Python).
def fibonacci(number): if number <= 1: return number else: return fibonacci(number - 1) + fibonacci(number - 2) print("The 8th Fibonacci number is:", fibonacci(8)) 6. Tables#Tables use pipes (|) and hyphens (-) to define columns and headers.
title: Random example in MD lang

content:
problem: “AC not cooling, high energy use” tools: [“multimeter”, “refrigerant gauge”]
steps: [“1. Isolated power”, “2. Repaired leak”, “3. Recharged system”]
outcome: “Unit cooling at 18¬∞C”
Diagnosis#Found low refrigerant using a gauge. Identified a leak in the evaporator coil.
Solution#Isolated power to the unit. Repaired the leak using a soldering kit. Recharged the system with R-410A refrigerant. Tested the unit to ensure proper cooling. Images#Before After
summary: AC not cooling, high energy use
title: AC Leak Fix
